page.title: 09Witherley Church Restoration
page.content:
After standing for 500 years, St Peter's Church in Witherley is in need of extensive restoration.
The masonry of the south wall of the church needs cutting back to where it is not crumbling.
The stained glass needs renewing. It has been there from when the church was first built. The glass will be taken down and taken to London, where it will be renewed by expert repairers.
The repairs are going to cost Â£48,000. The parish will receive a grant of 40% of this from the government. Â£20,000 has been raised so far, including a donation from Queen Elizabeth the Queen Mother.
